p: Nickel is an essential element for the growth and development of plants mainly for the activation of enzymes such as urea and glyoxalase. Nickel is also important in the germination process of seeds, in photosynthesis and in the metabolism of nitrogen [ 32], but it can become toxic for plants at high concentrations (more than 10 to 1000 mg/kg d.w. depend on plant sensitivity) [ 33].
